ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Apollo 15 Solar Wind Measurements at the Lunar Surface 28-s Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, metadata versioned up to SPASE 2.6.0, reviewed by LFB 20230727

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: This data set contains the highest time resolution plasma data available (28 sec per spectrum) from the solar wind experiment onboard Apollo 15. Contained in each record are: time, proton density, alpha-to-proton ratio, bulk speed, angle of flow, most probable thermal speed, and various housekeeping and fit parameters relating to the reliability of the calculated plasma parameters. During the local lunar night there is no solar wind signal so there are data gaps of about 15 days each lunation.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge NASA Space Physics Data Facility, National Space Science Data Center and the Principal Investigator for data usage.
